speaker: Speaker B
text: Kind of nervous.

speaker: Speaker A
text: Oh, please don't be nervous. This is just a simple conversation. So a lot of this is just process so to make sure that we have everything we need when you come in there. So like if there's an emergency, we know who can call, you know, and then if there was a If you, let's say you had a job and they like couldn't get in touch with you, they could call us and we could say, oh, well, here's a number we could, you know, send an email. Like it's just all so that we have stuff on file. Ain't nothing. None of these questions gonna be scary. No, so highest level of education that you've completed so far.

text: I think 10th grade. 10th. Something like that.

text: Yeah, yes, my cousins, my brothers, they all they bang. So it's like I was adopted into a into a Haitian family. Mmm. It's like they're very physical. Yeah, and they almost all of them are in jail for life right now.

speaker: Speaker B
text: because of dumb choices and you're here. So that's so I'm taking this as an opportunity, not a something to play with.

speaker: Speaker A
text: I hear you. I hear you. Do you want to go back to high school? Do you want to go get your GED?

speaker: Speaker B
text: I do. I would go back to high school, but I don't know if they'll even take me. I have four credits out of all of time I was supposed to be in high school. Okay, because I literally went for like, out of all high school, out of two years, ninth and 10th grade. I probably went like three weeks out of the whole two years.

speaker: Speaker A
text: Okay. So well, I guess my question really is do you want high school or do you prefer to get your GED?

speaker: Speaker B
text: I would rather have high school. But right now somebody told me GED and regular high school diploma doesn't look different, but I feel like if you were to go into a high-end job interview, whatever and they say, oh, do you have your high school diploma set and you say no, I have my GED...

speaker: Speaker A
text: I get where you're coming from. I'm not even going to try to convince you one way or the other, but I will say is that if you said I had my high school diploma, I'm sorry. If you said I went back and I got my high school diploma, I'm going to look at you a certain way, 'cause you went back and finished what you started. Right, but if you went got your GED, what we'll see is someone who went back and got finished what they started, but finished in a different way. Yeah, right. One does not look worse to at least to me.

speaker: Speaker B
text: Like they say, they say, oh, they're equivalent or whatever, but I feel like one looks better than the other. Maybe. People, yeah, possibly. I don't know. I just as long as I can get it. I really don't care. I just need a high school diploma because that's the gateway to success.

speaker: Speaker A
text: So one gateway, yeah, one gateway. It's not the yeah, it's one. There's gonna be for whatever it is you want to do for anything you want to do, just always gonna be multiple ways to get there. And you get to choose which one works for you.

speaker: Speaker B
